title: Choosing (The Repatriate Protocol Book 4)
features: Life is not meant to be lived in cages.

Fiona has spent her entire life waiting to be queen, but without the ability to produce an heir, she has been banished to tend the fields with the workers. After her mother gifts her with one final chance to further the royal lineage, Fiona meets Elliot at a planting ceremony, who whisks her away to the mountain, where a strange society dwells within its alien walls.

Culture shock gives way to curiosity when Fiona meets Leo, the ambitious president of the mountain-dwellers. Leo has big plans for Fiona, and although his businesslike demeanor initially grates on her, once his chilly exterior begins to melt, Fiona is no longer certain she wants to resist. . .
But is there more to this proposed union than Leo is letting on? What’s the
reason he’s so interested in joining with the outsiders? And does Fiona have what it takes to lead her people to liberation, no matter what the cost?
Find out in Choosing, the 4th installment of the deeply immersive, high-octane Repatriate Protocol series by Kelli Kimble!
description: by Kelli Kimble is a complex political drama that takes the intense Repatriate Protocol saga into unexplored territory by delving into the deeply-sanitized, almost Kubrickian culture of the newest crop of mountain dwellers. Its leader, Leo--written as a rare and masterful example of an anti-villain--rules with an iron fist covered in a velvet glove and is equal parts charismatic and manipulative, showing just enough empathy to keep the reader guessing at his true intentions.Our heroine, Fiona, is instantly lovable and (at first) adorably naïve, and her character arc from a Disney princess who has fallen from grace to a confident, strategizing, revolutionary queen is an undeniable strong point throughout the novel, leading to an immensely satisfying conclusion that--as with every hyper-suspenseful installment in the
series--will only leave readers salivating for more."
